results.title: F.D.R. 1882-1945
results.brief_description: A tribute to Franklin Delano Roosevelt, four times President of the United States, born 1882, died 1945, one of the most famous Americans. Using archival footage, the film gives an interesting insight into modern American history.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1967
results.brief_description: A brilliant finale to the 1967 British football season between the two London teams, Tottenham Hotspurs and Chelsea as they battle it out for the FA Cup at Wembley Stadium.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1965: soccer honours its greatest star
results.brief_description: A record of the 1965 FA Cup Final between two of England’s most famous soccer clubs, Liverpool and Leeds. Includes some background material on Sir Stanley Matthews, showing him with footballers from overseas who were visiting England to participate in celebrations marking his retirement from football and the Queen presenting the Cup.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1962
results.brief_description: Records the 1962 FA Cup Final played at Wembley Stadium between the Tottenham Hotspurs and Burnley. Use of slow motion camera work helps make this an outstanding record of a thrilling final as it follows Burnley’s attempt to stand up to the Spurs team at the peak of their form. The Queen and Prince Phillip were among the thousands of spectators.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1960
results.brief_description: The Football Association Challenge Cup Final is one of Britain’s great sporting events of the year. The 1960 Final was played between Blackburn Rovers and Wolverhampton Wanderers. This film attempts to capture the atmosphere of this great event played at Wembley Stadium near London before a crowd of 100,000 spectators.

results.title: F.A. Cup Final 1954
results.brief_description: The Football Association Challenge Cup final, 1954, between Preston North End and West Bromwich Albion, played at the Empire Stadium, Wembley. Shows the huge crowds, highlights of the game, and the presentation of the Cup by Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother.

results.title: F for fake = Verites et mensonges
results.creator_credit: Les Films des l'Apostrophe, Saci Filmes, Janus Film und Fernsehen (Frankfurt), Dominique Antoine, Francois Reichenbach and Orson Welles
results.brief_description: Orson Welles stars in and directs this feature/documentary on fake, forgery, art and illusion that well deserves the title, ‘film essay’. As a basis he uses an unfinished documentary (original footage by Francois Reichenbach) on Elmyr de Hory, a noted art forger. Included in Welles’ documentary within a documentary are interviews by Clifford Irving, biographer of de Hory. Welles injects his views on his Hollywood career and artistic originality and presents a short piece in which Pablo Picasso meets a beautiful woman.

results.title: F-111 the first flight
results.creator_credit: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Trainee pilots and navigators undergo an intensive training course before they are allowed to operate the supersonic F-111 strike aircraft for the first time. Shows some of the students on their first flight in an F-111. Credits include: photography by Mal Lancaster; edited by Vincent Donovan; sound by Ron Townsend; commentated by Peter Gwynne and scripted by Greg Parry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Parry and Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations

results.title: Ezra Pound: poets' poet
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: Uses historic photographs, early documentary footage and the poet’s own recollections to explore the life of Ezra Pound. Born in Idaho, he spent his boyhood in Philadelphia, before moving to England. Other aspects of his life covered in this film are his asociation in Paris in the 1920s with other expatriates, such as Joyce, Stein and Hemingway, and his love affair with Rapallo and Venice. Some of the moods evoked by Pound’s poetry are highlighted. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Ezra Jack Keats (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel, Weston Woods Studios and Cynthia Freitag
results.brief_description: This film introduces the personality and style of Ezra Jack Keats, Caldecott Medallist, author and illustrator of well-known picture books. It concludes with an iconographic film rendition of one of his books “A Letter to Amy”.
